content: little woollie makes crochet log cabin square materials 8ply/dk yarn small amounts of different colours great for using up leftovers and scraps 4 5mm hook you can use any weight yarn you like just use the appropriate hook for the yarn weight and keep in mind the size of the finished square will change each square is approx 14cm x 14cm using 8ply/dk wool these squares are crocheted using linen stitch which creates a lovely fabric that is quite dense but also drapey the squares hold their shape nicely and i found they did not need blocking i made 35 squares for a 5 x 7 blanket hand sewing them together using blanket stitch alternatively you could crochet them together using single_crochet or slip_stitch i then added a simple border of single_crochet row with a picot stitch in the final round i am using us crochet terminology for uk/australian terminology single_crochet = double_crochet i hope you enjoy hooking up this square how to make a square centre square using first colour chain 13 row 1 single_crochet in 3rd chain from hook *ch1 skip 1 chain single_crochet in next chain* repeat * to * 4 more times along row ending with last single_crochet in last chain of row chain 2 turn work 6 st row 2 single_crochet in last chain space of previous row *ch1 single_crochet in next chain space* repeat * to * 4 more times ending with the last single_crochet in the turning chain space of the previous row chain 2 turn work repeat row 2 x 10 more times for a total of 11 row excluding chain row this is the centre square of your log cabin square completed bind off second round of colour side 1 join next colour to last single_crochet of centre square and rotate work 90 degrees so you are working along the side of the square row 1 ch2 *single_crochet ch1* 6 times making the single_crochet evenly along the whole side of the square and ending with a single_crochet and leaving off the last chain chain 2 turn work row 2 single_crochet in last chain space of previous row *ch1 single_crochet in next chain space* repeat * to * 4 more times ending with the last single_crochet in the turning chain space of the previous row chain 2 turn work repeat row 2 x 3 more times for a total of 5 row at the end of the last row omit the chain 2 and don t turn work over this is the first side of the second ring of colour rotate work 90 degrees so we are working along the bottom side of the centre square side 2 row 1 ch2 *single_crochet ch1* 8 times making the single_crochet evenly along the whole side of the square and ending with a single_crochet and leaving off the last chain chain 2 turn work row 2 single_crochet in last chain space of previous row *ch1 single_crochet in next chain space* repeat * to * 6
